data.enText: a strong regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements
to dance to the rhythm of the music

data.chText: 节奏快的 / 慢的 / 平稳的音乐
他的演奏好像不合节拍。
data.enText: He can't seem to play in rhythm .

data.chText: 小船随着海浪起伏有致。
data.enText: The boat rocked up and down in rhythm with the sea.

data.chText: 天生节奏感很强的舞蹈者
data.enText: a dancer with a natural sense of rhythm (= the ability to move in time to a fixed beat)
a regular pattern of changes or events

tr: natural family planning in which ovulation is assumed to occur 14 days before the onset of a period (the fertile period would be assumed to extend from day 10 through day 18 of her cycle)
the arrangement of spoken words alternating stressed and unstressed elements
the basic rhythmic unit in a piece of music
example: the piece has a fast rhythm

tr: an interval during which a recurring sequence of events occurs
example: the never-ending cycle of the seasons

value.def: A rhythm is a regular series of sounds or movements.

example.ex: His music of that period fused the rhythms of Jazz with classical forms...
example.tran: 他那个时期的音乐将爵士乐的韵律和古典音乐的形式融合在了一起。

example.ex: He had no sense of rhythm whatsoever...
She could hear the constant rhythm of his breathing.
example.tran: 她能听见他均匀而有节奏的呼吸。

value.tran: (声音或运动的)节奏，韵律，节拍

value.def: A rhythm is a regular pattern of changes, for example changes in your body, in the seasons, or in the tides.

example.ex: Begin to listen to your own body rhythms.
example.tran: 开始聆听你自己身体的节奏。

example.ex: ...the seasonal rhythm of the agricultural year.

value.tran: (身体、季节、潮汐等的)规律性变化，节奏

trans: 窦性心律；窦性节律；正常窦性心律；心律；窦房律
节奏布鲁斯， 节奏蓝调 (由布鲁斯和爵士乐综合而成的节奏感很强的音乐)
乐队的节奏乐器组(通常由鼓、低音提琴，有时还有钢琴组成)
